intro: Verbascum friedrichsthalianum, commonly known as the Friedrichsthalianum mullein, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems covered in soft, fuzzy hairs. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight, often found in rocky or dry habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Scrophulariaceae family.
